name: Extended Composite ID Number and Name for Persons
description: The XCN data type is used for identifying persons with enhanced capabilities beyond the basic CN data type. It provides comprehensive person identification including ID numbers, names, professional designations, and assigning authorities. XCN replaces CN for person identification as of HL7 v2.3 and supports complex naming scenarios, multiple identifier types, and detailed professional credential representation.

XCN.1.name: ID Number
XCN.1.description: The person's identifier within the specified assigning authority. This is the unique ID assigned to the person by an organization or system.

XCN.2.name: Family Name
XCN.2.description: The person's surname or family name. The primary component of the person's legal name.

XCN.3.name: Given Name
XCN.3.description: The person's first name or given name. The personal name by which the person is commonly known.

XCN.4.name: Middle Initial or Name
XCN.4.description: The person's middle name or initial. May include multiple middle names or initials.

XCN.5.name: Suffix
XCN.5.description: Name suffix such as Jr., Sr., III, etc. Generational or honorary suffixes that follow the person's name.

XCN.6.name: Prefix
XCN.6.description: Name prefix such as Dr., Prof., Hon., etc. Professional or courtesy titles that precede the person's name.

XCN.7.name: Degree
XCN.7.description: Academic degree or professional designation such as MD, RN, PhD, etc. Educational qualifications and professional certifications.

XCN.8.name: Source Table
XCN.8.description: Identifies the source table or coding system from which the ID number is drawn. Provides context for the identifier type.

XCN.9.name: Assigning Authority
XCN.9.description: The organization or system that assigned the ID number. Hierarchic designator for the authority responsible for the identifier.

XCN.10.name: Name Type Code
XCN.10.description: Specifies the type of name being represented (e.g., legal name, display name, alias). Indicates the context and usage of the name.

XCN.11.name: Identifier Check Digit
XCN.11.description: Check digit for the ID number to verify accuracy. Used for validation of the identifier value.

XCN.12.name: Check Digit Scheme
XCN.12.description: The algorithm used to generate the check digit. Specifies the validation method for the identifier.

constraints.identification: At least one of ID Number or Family Name should be populated for meaningful identification
constraints.checkDigitLogic: If check digit is present, check digit scheme should also be specified
constraints.nameTypeContext: Name Type Code provides context for how the name should be interpreted

usage: Patient next of kin and emergency contacts
commonFields: Various healthcare provider and person identification fields

generationHints.typical: Use realistic healthcare provider names with appropriate professional credentials
generationHints.providers: Include relevant medical degrees (MD, DO, RN, NP, PA) and specialties
generationHints.identifiers: Use realistic provider IDs, NPI numbers, and employee identifiers
generationHints.authorities: Include appropriate assigning authorities (hospitals, medical boards, registries)

nameTypes.B: Business - name used in business context

professionalContext.healthcare: Primary use for healthcare provider identification and credentialing
professionalContext.licensing: Supports professional licensing and certification tracking
professionalContext.directories: Used in medical staff directories and provider databases
professionalContext.billing: Supports provider identification in billing and claims processing

validationRules.minimumData: At least XCN.1 (ID Number) or XCN.2 (Family Name) should be populated
validationRules.checkDigitConsistency: If XCN.11 is present, XCN.12 should specify the validation algorithm
validationRules.authorityValidation: Assigning Authority should be valid and recognized organization
validationRules.nameTypeValidation: Name Type Code should reference valid table values
validationRules.professionalCredentials: Degrees and titles should be appropriate for healthcare context

enhancementsOverCN.assigningAuthority: XCN.9 provides clear identification of the organization that assigned the ID
enhancementsOverCN.nameType: XCN.10 specifies the context and usage of the name being represented
enhancementsOverCN.checkDigitSupport: XCN.11 and XCN.12 provide identifier validation capabilities
enhancementsOverCN.standardization: More standardized approach to person identification in healthcare
enhancementsOverCN.interoperability: Better support for cross-system person identification

relatedDataTypes.CN: Composite ID Number and Name - predecessor to XCN
relatedDataTypes.XPN: Extended Person Name - for detailed name representation without ID
relatedDataTypes.HD: Hierarchic Designator - used for assigning authority
relatedDataTypes.CX: Extended Composite ID - for patient identifiers with check digits

implementationNotes.replacement: Replaces CN data type for person identification as of HL7 v2.3
implementationNotes.flexibility: Supports various person identification scenarios in healthcare
implementationNotes.professional: Designed specifically for healthcare professional identification
implementationNotes.standards: Aligns with healthcare industry standards for provider identification
implementationNotes.integration: Facilitates integration with provider directories and credentialing systems
